articles.content: The Centre is in favour of inviting fresh bids for the divestment of state-owned Central Electronics Ltd (CEL) following discussions with the law ministry, said people with knowledge of the matter. A… [+2999 chars]

articles.author: Kirtika Suneja
articles.title: India's Q1 growth seen in double digits but inflation, crude prices pose risks - Economic Times
articles.description: Data released June 1 showed goods and services tax (GST) collections topped ₹1.4 lakh crore for the third month running in May, while the manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) remained firmly in the growth zone at 54.6 in that month.
articles.content: India's economy is off to a strong start in the new financial year with several high-frequency indicators holding firm despite multiple headwinds, bouncing back from the tepid fourth quarter of FY22.… [+2686 chars]

articles.title: Air India Reduces Age Of Voluntary Retirement, Offers Cash Incentive - NDTV
articles.description: In an apparent bid to encourage a significant section of its employees to voluntarily retire, Air India on Wednesday reduced the eligibility age from 55 to 40 and announced cash incentive.
articles.content:
Tata Group took control of Air India on January 27 after successfully winning a bid last year.
